instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
The macbook entered wet and with sulfate in this area:

[ATTACH type="full" width="338px"]60627[/ATTACH]

It has been cleaned, I replace the components and now there is no chime: green - orange led, cpu heats up and there is usb activity.

PPBUS_G3H = 12.57V
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL = 20.30V
PPDCIN_G3H = 20.30V
PP3V42_G3H = 3.43V
PPVRTC_G3H = 3.33V
PP5V_S5 = 5.15V
PP5V_S4 = 5.15V
PP5V_S0 = 5.15V
PP3V3_S5 = 3.33V
PP3V3_S4 = 3.33V
PP3V3_SUS = 3.33V
PP3V3_S3 = 3.33V
PP3V3_S0 = 3.33V
PP5V_S0_FET = 5.15V
PP3V3_S0_FET = 3.33V
PP1V05_SUS = 1.06V
VCORE = 1.70V

Thanks.

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
If you have USB activity for sure, do PRAM reset.
This should bring chime back.

Did you test external video?

Do you get 5V at pins 28-30 of J8300, in the first few seconds at least?
LCD_HPD_CONN and DP_INT_HPD should go high at same time.

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
PRAM RESET but still the same.

No signal on external monitor.

LCD_HPD_CONN = 0V
DP_INT_HPD = 0V

In power supply, the current goes from 0.02V up to 0.95A directly.

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
Do you really have USB activity?
Flashing macOS pendrive, not just power.
What about PLT_RESET_L?

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
I know there is USB power because it charges my phone and I was able to turn on a UV lamp.

PLT_RESET_L = 0.00V.

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
USB power is not the same as USB activity!!!
Your board can't have activity, if PLT_RESET_L stays low.
I wouldn't ask you for external video, or PRAM reset, if you didn't say to have USB activity.

Check pins 7 & 3 of U1950.

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message: Check now CPU_VR_READY and CPU_VCCST_PWRGD levels.

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
Sorry for delay .


CPU_VR_READY  - 1.05 V and  CPU_VCCST_PWRGD is 1.02V

threads.title: 820-3476 No power
threads.message:
You may have crap accumulated under PCH/CPU.
Try heating with quality flux.
